sourcesContent:
import React from "react"
import { Typography } from "@mui/material"
import IntroduceWorkArticle from "../molecules/IntroduceWorkArticle"
import MBUX from "assets/images/MBUX.jpg"

function Mbux(): React.ReactElement {
  return (
    <IntroduceWorkArticle
      title="MBUX - Mercedes-Benz User Experience"
      imageSrc={MBUX}
    >
      <Typography variant="h4">Role</Typography>
      <Typography variant="body1">
        At Mercedes-Benz Research and Development, I was responsible for UI
        concepts (such as wireframes, and information architecture) of the
        brand's GPS navigation system. The product is called MBUX. See more
        about it on the link. Challenges When I joinded the company, the product
        was catastropic. Even in the production release, the entire system
        constantly kept crashing, which, as a matter of course, resulted a
        number of customer complaints. First, I had to find out why that
        situation was happening. The biggest problem I found was too many
        "Japan-specific" features. Due to historical reason, Japanese GPS
        navigation system evoloved in peculiar way. Therefore, the product and
        the process of development have been so much complicated. I had to align
        the Japan-specifi UI to global UI Design Strategy I asked myself "are
        those Japan-specific features really necessary?". To find out, I
        conducted an online survey. I asked Japanese users how often they user
        such conventional features. As a result, I found a lot of those features
        were not used anymore. Therefore, I reduced a number of those
        over-localized features. This resulted significant improvements of
        system stability, and it allowed me to import many advanced features
        that were standard in other countries.
      </Typography>
    </IntroduceWorkArticle>
  )
}

export default Mbux
